properties.query:
let lookBack = 1d;
SigninLogs 
| where TimeGenerated >= ago(lookBack)
| where ResultType == "50057"
| extend Location = strcat(LocationDetails.city, " ", LocationDetails.state, " ", LocationDetails.countryOrRegion)
| summarize StartTimeUtc = min(TimeGenerated), EndTimeUtc = max(TimeGenerated), disabledAccountLoginAttempts = count(), 
    disabledAccountsTargeted = dcount(UserPrincipalName), applicationsTargeted = dcount(AppDisplayName), disabledAccountSet = make_set(UserPrincipalName), 
    applicationSet = make_set(AppDisplayName)
    by IPAddress, Location
| order by disabledAccountLoginAttempts desc
| join kind= leftouter (
    // Consider these IPs suspicious - and alert any related  successful sign-ins
    SigninLogs
    | where TimeGenerated >= ago(lookBack)
    | where ResultType == 0
    | summarize
        successfulAccountSigninCount = dcount(UserPrincipalName),
        successfulAccountSigninSet = make_set(UserPrincipalName, 15)
        by IPAddress
    // Assume IPs associated with sign-ins from 100+ distinct user accounts are safe
    | where successfulAccountSigninCount < 100
    )
    on IPAddress 
| extend successfulAccountSigninCount = iif(isnotempty(successfulAccountSigninCount), successfulAccountSigninCount, 0)
| order by disabledAccountLoginAttempts
| extend timestamp = StartTimeUtc, IPCustomEntity = IPAddress
// removes entries where the IP address is owned by DoD. This is to eliminate entries most likely cause by DHCP.
| where IPCustomEntity !startswith "140."
// removes entries where there were no successful signins
| where successfulAccountSigninCount != 0
// expands the signin sets so theres multiple entries per successful signin user
| mv-expand successfulAccountSigninSet
// changes these two columns to strings rather than dynamic columns for next compare
| extend disabledAccountSet = tostring(disabledAccountSet[0]), successfulAccountSigninSet = tostring(successfulAccountSigninSet)
// remove entries where the successful signin is from the same user who has now had their account enabled
| where split(disabledAccountSet, "disable.")[1] != successfulAccountSigninSet
| summarize successfulAccountSigninSet = make_set(successfulAccountSigninSet) by StartTimeUtc, disabledAccountSet, successfulAccountSigninCount, timestamp, IPCustomEntity, EndTimeUtc, disabledAccountLoginAttempts, disabledAccountsTargeted, tostring(applicationSet), Location
| project-reorder StartTimeUtc, EndTimeUtc, disabledAccountSet ,disabledAccountsTargeted, disabledAccountLoginAttempts, IPCustomEntity, Location, applicationSet, successfulAccountSigninSet, timestamp
properties.displayName: Sign-ins from IPs that attempt sign-ins to disabled accounts
properties.description:
Identifies IPs with failed attempts to sign in to one or more disabled accounts signed in successfully to another account.
References: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/reports-monitoring/reference-sign-ins-error-codes
50057 - User account is disabled. The account has been disabled by an administrator.
PLATFORM:Azure AD,Microsoft 365,IaaS,Windows
MITRE:TA0001;T1078;T1078.001;T1078.004,TA0006;T1110;T1110.001;T1110.002;T1110.003;T1110.004
